data.title: Promenade in Berlin
data.meta_description: Kastanienallee - One of the creative centers of Berlin in Prenzlauer Berg. Small boutiques and showrooms next door with restaurants and cafes.
data.text:
The Kastanienallee in Prenzlauer Berg runs from the underground station Eberswalder Straße to Fehrbelliner Straße. It is one of the most popular promenades in Berlin. The street is lined with modern cafés, boutiques and innovative small shops.

Designers offer their collections and artists realize them in temporary projects, making the streets one of the creative centers of the city for many observers. The lively shopping street is equally popular with Berliners and tourists from all over the world.

The Kastanienallee is often called the creative centre. Not only designers offer great things, but also artists in temporary projects. That’s why the shopping mile is not only popular with Berliners, many tourists from all over the world come and go there. There are also galleries, second-hand shops and stylish fashion boutiques. It’s the perfect place to discover new trends or get a glimpse into the world of fashion. Situated directly in Prenzlauer Berg, you should also make a detour into Oderberger Straße. In this straightforward street you can relax with a nice cup of coffee or a small lunch. Afterwards you can return to town from Rosenthaler Platz underground station.

JUMPBerlin says:

The perfect place to discover new trends and gain insights into Berlin’s creative scene. Stroll through the chestnut avenue, let yourself be sprinkled by the many small shops and take a breather in one of the cafés and restaurants!
